skillTree.localised_description: A general's horse can be their most trusted and daring companion. Just don't name him 'Daisy'.

effects.description: Mount: Barded Warhorse

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: An Imperial pegasus is a noble, winged steed, intelligent and loyal.

effects.description: Mount: Imperial Pegasus

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: Gausser leads the hardened Nordland armies against all foes from atop his enormous black and white Imperial Griffon, Schwartzmere. Each foe slain is one less to defile this mighty province.

effects.description: Mount: Imperial Griffon

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

effects.description: Mount: Imperial Griffon
Melee attack: +6 for Theoderic Gausser (when riding Schwartzmere)
Melee defence: +6 for Theoderic Gausser (when riding Schwartzmere)
Missile resistance: 10% for Theoderic Gausser (when riding Schwartzmere)

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord belts out orders and can be heard even across a battlefield smothered in the grim noise of war.

effects.description: Leadership aura size: +25%
Passive ability: "Hold the Line!"

skillTree.localised_description: The relentless drive and fury of the Hammer, harnessed for the protection of this ward’s bearer.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 10%

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

skillTree.localised_description: Nordland Marines are resented in many seaside communities. When raiders attack, however, these same citizens are quick to accept the aid of battle-hardened Marines.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain: +25% for Free Company Militia units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +10 for Free Company Militia units
	(Lord's army)

Bonus vs. Infantry: +8 for Free Company Militia units
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Free Company Militia units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Many sea fortresses and watch-towers line the coast of Nordland, as raiders from across the Sea of Claws are an all too common threat that can't be ignored without dire consequences.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Norscan Tribes
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +8 when fighting against Norscan Tribes
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +10 when fighting against Norscan Tribes
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Elector Counts of Nordland have accumulated an impressive collection of titles and claims over the millennia, which if enforced, would make them rulers of the entire northern portions of the Empire. Reality has a way of foiling the most grandiose ambitions, however, and the Count's rule extends to barely half of the lands he claimed.

effects.description:
Income from raiding: +10%
	(armies in local province)

Income from sacking and looting settlements: +15%
	(armies in local province)
Diplomatic relations: -10 with Humans

skillTree.localised_description: Since its incoporation as a province, Nordland is famous for housing the Imperial Navy and its heavily tolled coastal roads, which provide both safe passage for rich merchants heading towards the city of Marienburg and the main source of income that funds it's economy.

effects.description:
Growth: +5
	(all provinces)

Construction cost: -40% for Ports
	(factionwide)
Income from trade tariffs: +5%

skillTree.localised_description: Gausser is a fearsome warrior-lord who embodies his people's tenacity and war-like nature to its very core. As Elector Count, he also holds the title of Prince of Marienburg, however he is forbidden to enter the city on pain of death.

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Rage"
	(Lord's army)

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee.

effects.description: Income from post-battle loot: +20%

skillTree.localised_description: Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.

effects.description: Melee defence: +5

skillTree.localised_description: Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.

effects.description: Charge bonus: +15
Charge bonus: +30

skillTree.localised_description: Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.

effects.description: Armour: +7
Armour: +15

skillTree.localised_description: The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.

effects.description: Hit points: +7%
Hit points: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!

skillTree.localised_description: From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.

effects.description: Ability: "Foe-Seeker"

skillTree.localised_description: Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.

Weapon strength: +20%

skillTree.localised_description: This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.

skillTree.localised_description: As an elected governing official of the Empire, an Elector Count has the power and authority to raise troops from his home province. In times of need, or if a regiment is being raised by the right individual, the Count may grant his favor to a unit.
"The time to strike is now!"

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

factionEffects.localised_description: Theodoric Gausser is the Elector Count of Nordland, the only Imperial province with a coastline. It is a wild and dangerous place, both on land and sea. It is with these troubles on his worried brow that Theodoric Gausser rules his province. Such an embattered land has led to a hardy folk, and Gausser is certainly among them. He leads the hardened Nordland armies against all foes from atop his enormous black and white Imperial Griffin, Schwartzmere. Each foe slain is one less to defile this mighty province.

effects.description: Starts with a defensive alliance with Laurelorn

Control: +2 for every concurrent war with a neighbouring faction
	(all provinces)
Income from Ports: +10%

items.colour_text: The tough, scaly hide of the Sea Dragon provides excellent protection against all manner of blows.

effects.description: Enemy Hero action success chance: -10%
Melee defence: +5
Physical resistance: 10%
Passive ability: "Sea Dragon Cloak"

items.colour_text: The Elector Counts always have a regiment of Greatswords with them at all times, for they act both as a bodyguard regiment and as a reserve force of elite warriors that has the potential to turn the tide of many battles.

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Guardian"
	(assigned unit)

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

effects.description:
Attribute: Unbreakable
	(assigned unit)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Theoderic Gausser or known more formally as Elector Count Theoderic Gausser, Grand Baron of Nordland, Prince of Salzenmund, Lord of Laurelorn, Duke of Marienburg, and Terror of the Norscans. Yes, that is a lot of titles.

effects.description: Immortal

Leadership: +1 for every concurrent war
	(all units in army)
